hero.title: Jennifer Baumgart
hero.subtitle: Where logic, applied AI and creativity meet and user experience comes first

about.title: About Me
about.aboutText: Hi! I'm Jennifer Baumgart — a Front-End Developer specialising in React, Next.js, TypeScript, and UI/UX Design with a track record of delivering responsive, accessible, and performance-driven interfaces. My experience spans data-driven dashboards, SaaS platforms, and global marketing websites, always bridging design and code to create user-centred products. With a background in Chemistry, I bring analytical precision and user empathy to every project. I thrive in cross-functional teams, translating complex requirements into intuitive, visually engaging experiences, and I'm passionate about accessibility (WCAG) and inclusive design. Whether crafting a design system, integrating APIs, or optimising performance, my focus is on creating solutions that are as functional as they are beautiful.

experienceData.title: Fundamentals and First Steps
experienceData.education: Introductory courses in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, combined with self-study on online platforms.
experience: Built simple, fully responsive personal websites, experimenting with design principles and accessibility.
Completed beginner projects to solidify core programming concepts and layout structures.

experienceData.title: Advanced Learning and First Professional Experience
experienceData.education: Started the Foundation Degree (UK Level 5 equivalent) in Computer Science & Software Development at UNINTER, focusing on web development and UX/UI.
experience: Joined The Brooklyn Brothers as a Junior Front-End Developer, contributing to Unilever brands (AXE & SEDA) by building pixel-perfect, responsive components in Adobe Experience Manager.
Performed DQM checks, collaborated with QA and DevOps to resolve issues via Jira/Wrike, and ensured zero critical launch errors.
Enhanced UX skills through Google UX Design Certificate projects, moving from concept to high-fidelity prototypes.

experienceData.title: Freelance and Skill Expansion
experienceData.education: Completed specialised courses in React, Node.js, TypeScript, and accessibility best practices.
experience: Worked as a freelance Front-End Developer and UX Designer, delivering responsive, accessible applications using React, Next.js, and TypeScript.
Led end-to-end UX processes, translating client goals into wireframes, prototypes, and design systems with 98% design-to-code fidelity.
Implemented inclusive design improvements (WCAG) that increased user satisfaction and engagement.

experienceData.title: Building Complex, Impact-Driven Solutions
experienceData.education: Graduated with distinction (9.4/10) in Computer Science & Software Development. Completed Full-Stack Web Development Programme (Blusoft / SENAC) and The Web Developer Bootcamp.
experience: At Minerva Controls, designed and implemented real-time, data-intensive dashboards using Figma, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Python, improving usability for clients like Petrobrás and Ambev.
Integrated RESTful APIs, streamlined complex workflows, and led automated testing implementation with Selenium and GitHub Actions CI/CD.
Developed Compath, a SaaS platform using React, Next.js, and a Python KNN model to deliver AI-powered business recommendations with gamified UX flows.
Built VidaPlus, a hospital management system with React, Node.js, Express, and PostgreSQL, focusing on usability, accessibility, and intuitive data management.

Won 1st place at the Health Tech Hackathon: Conecta Saúde (2025) with Humanus, a career management platform for nurses and nursing technicians, built in just 3 nights using Next.js, Tailwind, and Node.js.

projectsData.title: Humanus - 1st Place Health Tech Hackathon (August 2025)
projectsData.tagline: Career management platform for healthcare professionals.
projectsData.description: Humanus was developed during the Health Tech Hackathon: Conecta Saúde, where we achieved 1st place. The platform supports nurses and nursing technicians in their professional development by providing career planning, structured feedback, microlearning and gamified rewards. I was responsible for the frontend in Next.js and Tailwind, as well as the integration with the mocked backend in Node.js/Express.
features: Dashboard with general stats, quick actions and mood tracker.
Feedbacks (received and given), with filters and history.
Training and microlearning modules in short lessons.
Career plan with milestones, OKRs and 1:1 scheduling.
Rewards store with a gamified points system.
projectsData.visualIdentity: Blue and turquoise tones convey trust, innovation and clarity. A clean layout with rounded cards, intuitive icons and simplified navigation ensures accessibility and usability across all profiles.
projectsData.techUsed: The design was created in Figma, with high-fidelity wireframes and a modern blue & turquoise visual identity. The frontend was developed in Next.js, React and TypeScript, styled with Tailwind CSS and shadcn/ui components. The backend was mocked in Node.js/Express, simulating RESTful APIs for career, feedback and microlearning endpoints. Zustand was used for global state, React Hook Form and Zod for validations. The project was deployed on Vercel.

challengesAndSolutions.challenge: Deliver a functional solution in only three hackathon nights.
challengesAndSolutions.solution: Used Next.js and Tailwind to speed up development and Node.js mock backend to simulate real APIs.

challengesAndSolutions.challenge: Represent the professional journey in a clear and engaging way.
challengesAndSolutions.solution: Designed a Career Timeline with OKRs and 1:1s, plus gamification to increase user engagement.

projectsData.title: Compath
projectsData.description: Compath is a platform that helps entrepreneurs discover niches, analyse competition, and identify opportunities based on their region. It features a coin-based system where searches consume credits, which can be earned through invites or purchases. It also includes a learning hub with courses. I'm leading the project, working not only on the front-end development, from Figma designs to a responsive React interface, but also on the back-end integration, database management, API development, and AI implementation.
features: Search for business opportunities by region.
Gamified coin-based system.
AI-driven recommendations and analysis.
Interactive dashboard with a user-friendly design.
projectsData.visualIdentity: Modern, vibrant, and goal-oriented. The interface uses a mix of deep blue and soft greens to convey trust and innovation. Icons and cards reinforce clarity and decision-making. The interface is clean, modular, and designed to navigate complex information with clarity and confidence.
projectsData.techUsed: Compath is being developed using a modern full-stack approach. The front-end leverages Next.js and TypeScript for robust, type-safe development and seamless routing, while TailwindCSS ensures a responsive and visually consistent UI. The back-end is powered by Node.js and Express, providing scalable API endpoints, and MongoDB is used for flexible, document-based data storage. Integration with the OpenAI API enables advanced AI-driven features. UI/UX design was crafted in Figma, allowing for rapid prototyping and user testing before implementation.

challenges.challenge: Designing an intuitive interface for complex AI results.
challenges.solution: Created modular components and clear visual hierarchies to present information in digestible formats, using cards and tooltips for additional context.

challenges.challenge: Incorporating gamification without overwhelming the user.
challenges.solution: Balanced visual elements and feedback systems with simple reward mechanics, clearly displaying coin balances and goals.

challenges.challenge: Handling user input and feedback to customise AI results.
challenges.solution: Structured clean forms and filters to feed structured data to the backend AI logic, ensuring accuracy and usability.

projectsData.title: VidaPlus
projectsData.description: VidaPlus is my capstone project, developed by myself. It's a hospital and healthcare service management system focussed on accessibility, usability, and intuitive dashboards. It supports role-based access (patient, doctor, admin). I handled the front-end and am currently working on the back-end with Node.js, Express, PostgreSQL, and Prisma.
features: Patient registration and appointment scheduling.
Appointment scheduling, cancellation, and notifications
Secure login for doctors, admins, and patients.
Healthcare professional management (schedules, prescriptions, records)
Dashboard with service history and charts.
Telemedicine with secure video consultations
projectsData.visualIdentity: Soft teal and greens convey calm and trust, creating a soothing experience for healthcare professionals and patients. Rounded elements and well-structured sections reduce cognitive load, ensuring accessibility and performance across devices.
projectsData.techUsed: This project was designed in Figma, where high-fidelity wireframes and a custom style guide were created to ensure a modern, accessible, and responsive UI across all devices. The frontend was developed using React with TypeScript for robust component architecture and type safety. Vite was used for fast builds, and Tailwind CSS provided utility-first styling. Navigation was handled by React Router DOM, while React Hook Form and Zod enabled efficient form management and validation. Chart.js and react-chartjs-2 were used for data visualisation. The backend is being built using a PostgreSQL database, authentication, real-time updates, and storage—all managed via secure environment variables. Prisma is being used for database interactions, ensuring type safety and efficient queries. The REST API was built with Express, providing a clear structure for data exchange between the front-end and back-end.

challengesAndSolutions.challenge: Designing a complex system with multiple user roles.
challengesAndSolutions.solution: Created modular components and role-based access control to ensure each user type has a tailored experience.

challengesAndSolutions.challenge: Ensuring data integrity and security in healthcare management.
challengesAndSolutions.solution: Implemented secure authentication, encrypted data storage, and role-based access control to protect sensitive information.

challengesAndSolutions.challenge: Making the system easy for all users.
challengesAndSolutions.solution: Designed a responsive and accessible interface.

projectsData.title: Monicount - Finances Application
projectsData.tagline: Minimalist finance management for variable income and low cognitive load.
projectsData.description: Monicount is a personal finance app designed for people with variable income, especially neurodivergent and chronically ill users who live with fatigue and executive dysfunction. It focuses on category-based budgeting (Essentials, Lifestyle, Investments/Goals), tracking planned vs actual spending, managing credit cards and setting personalised targets. Designed for clarity and calm, Monicount helps you visualise, plan and grow your finances without shame or overwhelm — one coin at a time.
features: Register income and expenses and organise them into intuitive categories.
Compare planned vs actual spending to understand patterns over time.
Visualise financial behaviour with low-stimulation, dynamic charts.
Filter by category, date and value for focused, detailed analysis.
Generate AI-driven summaries and gentle optimisation tips in natural language.
projectsData.visualIdentity: The design embraces minimalism with a calm, accessible feel. Low-stimulation layouts, high-contrast typography and clear hierarchy reduce cognitive load for users who may be tired, distracted or overwhelmed. A modern dark palette and considered spacing keep the focus on what matters without stress. The interface is intentionally predictable and forgiving, with clear navigation, responsive feedback and microcopy that avoids guilt or alarmist language.
projectsData.techUsed: For Monicount’s development, I used modern technologies to ensure performance and an accessible user experience. Next.js and React enable a dynamic, high-performance app, while TypeScript improves safety and maintainability. Tailwind CSS and shadcn/ui power fast, responsive styling with accessible UI components. Prisma integrates efficiently with a PostgreSQL database, Clerk handles secure authentication, and Stripe powers payments. Zod is used for schema validation and data integrity across the stack. AI-powered insights are implemented via the OpenAI API, with careful attention to concise, non-overwhelming messaging.

challengesAndSolutions.challenge: Designing a finance interface that works for users with fatigue and executive dysfunction.
challengesAndSolutions.solution: Simplified the information architecture, reduced visual noise and used clear categories, progressive disclosure and calm microcopy to lower cognitive load.

challengesAndSolutions.challenge: Providing AI insights without overwhelming or shaming the user.
challengesAndSolutions.solution: Framed AI outputs as short, supportive suggestions and neutral observations, avoiding judgemental language and highlighting small, actionable steps.

challengesAndSolutions.challenge: Ensuring real-time feedback without page reloads.
challengesAndSolutions.solution: Used React state management and Next.js server-side capabilities to deliver dynamic updates and smooth transitions across charts and tables.

projectsData.title: ToDo List
projectsData.description: This productivity tool allows users to create and manage task lists intuitively. Built with Svelte for snappy performance, it features a clean, responsive interface. Tasks can be created, updated, completed, and deleted with real-time feedback. The app uses a MySQL database for persistent storage, accessed through an Express-based REST API. It’s designed to be accessible and user-friendly, with inline editing and progress tracking.
features: Task CRUD Functionality: Users can create, update, complete, and delete tasks with real-time feedback.
Editable Interface: Tasks can be edited inline, allowing for a smooth and intuitive editing experience.
Progress Tracking: The app dynamically displays the number of created and completed tasks.
Responsive Design: Fully responsive layout ensures usability on desktops, tablets, and mobile devices.
Data Persistence: Tasks are stored in a MySQL database, enabling persistent data management through an Express-based REST API.
projectsData.visualIdentity: The visual identity of the ToDo List was crafted to be both modern and simple. A soft, violet and turquoise colour palette combined with a bold typographic hierarchy creates an aesthetically pleasing experience while keeping the user focussed on their tasks.
projectsData.techUsed: This project was developed using Svelte for the front-end framework, with TailwindCSS for utility-first styling. JavaScript handles client-side interactions, while Node.js and Express power the backend. Data is stored and managed using MySQL. The system communicates through a RESTful API, enabling efficient and scalable interaction between front and back end.

challengesAndSolutions.challenge: Implement inline editing without affecting the layout.
challengesAndSolutions.solution: Used local state management in Svelte to isolate the editable task and synchronise updates to the backend only on save.

challengesAndSolutions.challenge: Ensuring real-time updates without page reloads.
challengesAndSolutions.solution: Implemented Svelte's reactive features to automatically update the UI when tasks are created, updated, or deleted.

projectsData.title: First Portfolio
projectsData.description: My first portfolio, created to display my initial projects as a developer. Built with pure HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, it was an opportunity to learn the fundamentals of web development and responsive design.
features: Display of projects with descriptions and images.
Responsive design for desktop and mobile.
Simple and intuitive navigation.
Custom JavaScript animations for UI elements
Contact form functional
projectsData.visualIdentity: The visual identity was inspired by my personality, focussing on shades of pink, a card-style layout, and subtle transitions. I emphasised readability and tried to bring a calm and personal vibe that matched my story.
projectsData.techUsed: HTML5, CSS3, Vanilla JavaScript (for interactivity). No frameworks or libraries were used; everything was coded manually from scratch.

challengesAndSolutions.challenge: Building a responsive layout without using any frameworks.
challengesAndSolutions.solution: I learnt and applied media queries manually and structured the layout with Flexbox and percentage-based widths.

challengesAndSolutions.challenge: Creating engaging UI interactions with no libraries.
challengesAndSolutions.solution: Used basic JavaScript DOM manipulation and event listeners to create hover effects and simple transitions.
Studied examples online and followed basic principles of alignment, contrast, and spacing to maintain a clean look.

projectsData.title: Terra Pura
projectsData.tagline: Landing page for a sustainable cosmetics brand that blends nature and technology.
projectsData.description: Terra Pura is a fictional natural cosmetics brand focussed on sustainability, purity, and transparency. The landing page presents the brand's mission, best-selling products, and eco-friendly philosophy with a soft, modern design. The website invites conscious consumers to explore clean beauty solutions backed by nature and science. I designed and developed the interface, prioritising emotional connection, responsive layout, and clear storytelling.
features: Hero section with brand mission and immersive background
Highlight of best-selling products with smooth hover effects
Section about the brand’s sustainable values
Customer testimonials with quote cards
Lightweight build for fast loading times
projectsData.visualIdentity: A serene and organic look, with earthy tones (sage green, soft beige, off-white) and rounded UI elements. Gentle transitions and nature-inspired textures support a calm and mindful browsing experience. Typography is elegant and minimal, with generous white space.
projectsData.techUsed: The layout was designed in Figma with a custom design system tailored for wellness brands. ReactJS and Vite were used to build a fast, responsive, and scalable landing page. TailwindCSS provided utility-first styling with full mobile responsiveness. Animations were added using Framer Motion for scroll and hover interactions. Components were designed to be modular and easily reusable in a real e-commerce context.

challengesAndSolutions.challenge: Creating a luxurious feel while remaining minimal and clean.
challengesAndSolutions.solution: Balanced whitespace, soft gradients, and elegant typography to convey purity and sophistication.
Used earth tones, nature-inspired icons, and a storytelling-focussed layout to strengthen brand values.

projectsData.title: Gooday
projectsData.tagline: High-fidelity prototype for a holistic health and wellness platform designed in Figma.
projectsData.description: Gooday is a conceptual platform created exclusively in Figma, aimed at people who want to lead a healthy and active lifestyle. It brings together elements like nutritious eating, physical exercise, healthcare professional guidance, and wellness events, all in one cohesive digital experience. The prototype features intuitive navigation, vibrant visuals, and user-friendly flows designed to engage and motivate users towards better wellbeing.
features: Integrated sections for healthy recipes, workouts, and event listings
Interactive calendar for tracking activities and events
Community space for user stories and motivational content
projectsData.visualIdentity: Bright and energetic with a fresh colour palette inspired by nature with leafy greens. Clean, modern typography paired with smooth rounded corners and soft shadows create an inviting, approachable feel. The UI uses bold icons and subtle animations to enhance engagement without overwhelming the user.
projectsData.techUsed: The entire platform was designed as a high-fidelity prototype in Figma, focusing on UX/UI best practices for health and wellness apps. The design system ensures consistency across screens, with reusable components and accessibility considerations baked in.

challengesAndSolutions.challenge: Designing an engaging platform that balances motivation without feeling overwhelming.
challengesAndSolutions.solution: Used a bright but calming colour scheme, minimalistic layouts, and clear visual hierarchies to keep users focused and inspired.

challengesAndSolutions.challenge: Creating a seamless flow that integrates diverse content types—recipes, workouts, professionals, and events.
challengesAndSolutions.solution: Developed intuitive navigation and consistent card designs to unify different content, making discovery and interaction easy.

contact.title: Get in Touch
contact.thankYouMessage: Thank you for reaching out! I'll get back to you as soon as possible.
